body_html:
Here is build procedure I used on Ubuntu:

  1. Using Android Studio 2.3.0, import the project ( file --> new --> import (Select Eclipse or Gradle Project to import) --> example/android/build.gradle
  1. Let Android Studio to create wrapper for the project ( click OK)
  2. in build.gradle, change "def buildWithMake = true" ( this should not matter too much: bazel build is the same )
  3. make sure this one works: def makeNdkRoot = System.getenv('NDK_ROOT'); otherwise I use android studio's ndk version [ inside local.properties file, copy NDK.DIR setting to it ]
  4. Build --> Build APK.

there are some error messages coming from make build, but it could be ignored and APK is built on my system.

body:
Here is build procedure I used on Ubuntu:

1. Using Android Studio 2.3.0,  import the project ( file --> new --> import (Select Eclipse or Gradle Project to import) --> example/android/build.gradle
2) Let Android Studio to create wrapper for the project ( click OK)
3) in build.gradle, change "def buildWithMake = true"  ( this should not matter too much: bazel build is the same )
4) make sure this one works:  def makeNdkRoot = System.getenv('NDK_ROOT'); otherwise I use android studio's ndk version [ inside local.properties file, copy NDK.DIR setting to it ]
5) Build --> Build APK.

there are some error messages coming from make build, but it could be ignored and APK is built on my system.
